document.title: Colorado Academic Standards for Reading, Writing, and Communicating

490A6DE600E44CADB208E8D6988205B1.description: State, elaborate, and exemplify the concept of fair-mindedness.

F6A67BBB16034DC3B7CF746E6D35F35D.description: Ask primary questions of clarity, significance, relevance, and accuracy to improve quality of thinking.

54AA794AF8574D8D871E3D7D1736C2D3.description: Quality of thinking depends on the quality of questions.

E489A7CDBFAC4D10B657D75953530709.description: With guidance and support from adults, recall information from experiences or gather information from provided sources to answer a question.

C34C6D7B28CA44A3806B942FD6B5012F.description: Gather relevant information and check various information sources for accuracy (In a class discussion focused on butterflies, students ask questions related to a butterfly and the life cycle.)

A5A7434AE8544D42A2D31BF464C7DB57.description: Identify a significant question they are trying to answer, problem they are trying to solve, or issue they are trying to resolve.

E7B0BED5008040DE90543C0FC059F8EF.description: Identify a clear purpose for research or inquiry (If the class is learning about trees, is my need to know more about pets related?).

C3E3E3D4B8A24275A2FC5CE16291DCA1.description: Participate in shared research and writing projects (e.g., explore a number of books by a favorite author and express opinions about them).

C78C774B163D40C387D3ADAB263F0DFF.description: Identify purpose, information and question an issue.

ADE8F6899D0F48BBB917BDB19EFFB2A9.description: Use a variety of resources (such as direct observation, trade books, texts read aloud or viewed) to answer questions of interest through guided inquiry.

C82C086AA5774621B47FA5B155DD522B.description: Dictate questions that arise during instruction.

24BB71B8BD974207BDEEFC06201E01ED.description: A variety of locations must be explored to find information that answers questions of interest.

3D78304A104B4BB3AD97D079C9A3F898.description: Spell simple words phonetically, drawing on knowledge of sound-letter relationships.

17B0368586A34634B229434EF932B834.description: Write a letter or letters for most consonant and short-vowel sounds (phonemes).

60CABA6748244E98A8FC0373C8AA6C7B.description: Capitalize the first word in a sentence and the pronoun I.

9C3E762C54834EA6BF2C73803B05F8DF.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

A77FDFD2A9714839A795775537987E13.description: Write left to right and top to bottom.

B7DB3268AB6246749739200D4306AB90.description: Produce and expand complete sentences in shared language activities.

AA9FBB3F552E4FAF9EC46FC20D37D328.description: Use the most frequently occurring prepositions (e.g., to, from, in, out, on, off, for, of, by, with).

22D02F14038141F5ADA4B14B0AE562AD.description: Understand and use question words (interrogatives) (e.g., who, what, where, when, why, how).

2276CD6683AC4D79A238DC8C9B6930B7.description: Form regular plural nouns orally by adding /s/ or /es/ (e.g., dog, dogs; wish, wishes).

7D9E157AE1314779A083C523B7D0175E.description: Use frequently occurring nouns and verbs.

BBF509C897F140EBB4C7C5B3861CA747.description: Print many upper- and lowercase letters.

33365186962A41EE8212DD6592F521AF.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

FDBA60A78B7E4986B5385528F3101CCC.description: Appropriate mechanics and conventions are used to create simple texts.

57565BF762DF4574B8D98560011CF727.description: With guidance and support from adults, explore a variety of digital tools to produce and publish writing, including in collaboration with peers.

17B569F9048C4D5992E0C80F04B3F348.description: With guidance and support from adults, respond to questions and suggestions from peers and add details to strengthen writing as needed.

4581FED2B0EB417696A6ED48964FE33F.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to narrate a single event or several loosely linked events, tell about the events in the order in which they occurred, and provide a reaction to what happened.

9052E00542744002B94A3A6D3151E85C.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose informative/explanatory texts in which they name what they are writing about and supply some information about the topic.

4E24601520A34ED8989DA2D211B6D874.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose opinion pieces in which they tell a reader the topic or the name of the book they are writing about and state an opinion or preference about the topic or book (e.g., My favorite book is…).

5A84421B8D304FAC9D852232A95F543B.description: Text types and purposes, labels, and familiar words are used to communicate information and ideas.

D2D13ADE89E64760A1E4990CCB407875.description: Read emergent-reader texts with purpose and understanding.

27774A6D840347C39ECF54B3E3544E21.description: Distinguish between similarly spelled words by identifying the sounds of the letters that differ.

45775ED68746417DB7C9F22C8ABD2F55.description: Read common high-frequency words by sight (e.g., the, of, to, you, she, my, is, are, do, does).

464D83ED9923461C96A6D2C423466731.description: Associate the long and short sounds with the common spellings (graphemes) for the five major vowels.

DD091908AC464E47B0CBB8CA197A0690.description: Demonstrate basic knowledge of letter-sound correspondences by producing the primary or most frequent sound for each consonant.

DED05A4AE5404281A3DE0FD1AA315F01.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.

3E0B670B88574D1DBDEB300A1523FE75.description: Use the most frequently occurring inflections and affixes (e.g., -ed, -s, re-, un-, pre-, -ful, -less) as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word.

5A377C4C0EA245D89D03B3580982666D.description: Identify new meanings for familiar words and apply them accurately (e.g., knowing duck is a bird and learning the verb to duck).

B3286990F3DF4043B59A495F070D4D9A.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on kindergarten reading and content.

AD162A7FB1654270BEEBF90F1EA5F861.description: Add or substitute individual sounds (phonemes) in simple, one-syllable words to make new words.

78936F8B00954341972C6AD5AB3D491A.description: Isolate and pronounce the initial, medial vowel, and final sounds (phonemes) in three-phoneme (consonant-vowel-consonant, or CVC) words. (This does not include CVCs ending with /l/, /r/, or /x/.)

6F977B9369704E34871D3B1C34ADA19D.description: Blend and segment onsets and rimes of single-syllable spoken words.

AAE5EE99F56D4C899C77055798DD7FFA.description: Count, pronounce, blend, and segment syllables in spoken words.

F39F340691B64605B6DC9EA2C3A45AD8.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes).

BB752DB63C0D434881CA485F9A0D21B0.description: Recognize and name all upper- and lowercase letters of the alphabet.

20BD5D3AEF004E5185547097E081FCEA.description: Understand that words are separated by spaces in print.

36D921CF905B4D11B1437B5E48F637E8.description: Recognize that spoken words are represented in written language by specific sequences of letters.

BAB284075BA34794A0676BF5DE77E5C8.description: Follow words from left to right, top to bottom, and page by page.

865E2334E91540E4B183A6CA77F47C6A.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.

C16F8CC0571743B08CADE641244A6E60.description: Decoding words in print requires alphabet recognition and knowledge of letter sounds.

A4582DC5C33C479D83205CA40FC09FD5.description: Actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

E2C979AB62E742588CFFDC478922D4DA.description: Use Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity to:

349D07B686094DF19612AF51E3123290.description: With prompting and support, identify basic similarities in and differences between two texts on the same topic (e.g., in illustrations, descriptions, or procedures).

FF0E88C7F66D4E4BBF0A49CA01723146.description: With prompting and support, identify the reasons an author gives to support points in a text.

29B61B465B2D467CADBAC87DAA97B887.description: With prompting and support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the text in which they appear (e.g., what person, place, thing, or idea in the text an illustration depicts).

E5B6B9A9C4A2408FB91C08F93AE2BB8C.description: Use Integration of Knowledge and Ideas to:

51AA19B03CEE421C8AD2DD1BFC86BA7B.description: Name the author and illustrator of a text and define the role of each in presenting the ideas or information in a text.

3906A9570F214F4DBF7B65109520E323.description: Identify the front cover, back cover, and title page of a book.

EE3F25323BB342229435F419D10B6252.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about unknown words in a text.

D08221DE8C70461E84ECCCB2E141CCA9.description: With prompting and support, describe the connection between two individuals, events, ideas, or pieces of information in a text.

18EAF4338B8E44F1ABE5563AF00B486C.description: With prompting and support, identify the main topic and retell key details of a text.

C87950F9D47942758003CB6A805A2287.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

10322BBD2C73434ABD6B5BAB052823D7.description: Use Key Ideas and Details to:

75E991E665A6487A8E0EBDC67AA80CEE.description: A concept of print to read and a solid comprehension of informational text are the building blocks for reading.

20FA9AB853494F37B111DBFC66E6EEBC.description: Actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

85ECB4AE2D3F41EB8FC72311E062CD26.description: Use Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity to:

195A6A9EE3F24CF68D74E0C14C3E1944.description: With prompting and support, compare and contrast the adventures and experiences of characters in familiar stories.

4C02EBCB572B4C128B76973CB0EF7731.description: With prompting and support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the story in which they appear (e.g., what moment in a story an illustration depicts).

2C0DA81DF5E24111B85E3FF42E437054.description: Use Integration of Knowledge and Ideas to:

9B991F5DAB374D79A7C16B9A6D7A407F.description: With prompting and support, name the author and illustrator of a story and define the role of each in telling the story.

3F5D982E5CFD4378A36CA4376048A1B8.description: Recognize common types of texts (e.g., storybooks, poems).

C0D39AA44277478D9078A46BB5A4CC89.description: Ask and answer questions about unknown words in a text.

BA446ADB38B246F9B13C95FACD1A6B4C.description: With prompting and support, identify characters, settings, and major events in a story.

7064AA61374044518D914A766CE94EDC.description: With prompting and support, retell familiar stories, including key details.

E3D70724EE5F46489D1C9E4CC5A46046.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

48360027A57A45B4A68A09DB5112FB81.description: Use Key Ideas and Details to:

52E28BE8702D4D018184DE01FBEE6E69.description: A concept of print to read and a solid comprehension of literary texts are the building blocks for reading.

7084A06D6D2541EBAE277D681A9AFA20.description: Identify the initial, medial, and final phoneme (speech sound) of spoken words.

513C7EFD7605475792A0B57B93F794B2.description: Segment spoken words into onset (initial consonant sounds) and rime (vowel to end of syllable).

27EA47AB572C42889EF5EC2268411AE7.description: Blend sounds orally to make one-syllable words.

E71D987B9125403691A9F550281948AE.description: Identify words orally according to shared beginning or ending sounds.

6CFD140E32A0435885194111ACF82835.description: Vocal sounds produce words and meaning to create early knowledge of phonemic awareness.

2FBC5FE0A21B45A896D182EE67F56A56.description: Use words and phrases acquired through conversations, reading and being read to, and responding to texts.

47548A382E45433686D09F84177BBF09.description: Listen with comprehension to follow two-step directions.

16E9EC90C1A047A681D2B1381450F3CF.description: Ask and answer questions in order to seek help, get information, or clarify something that is not understood.

C5C4A75A11C34F559D28C5C518971B47.description: Confirm understanding of a text read aloud or information presented orally or through other media by asking and answering questions about key details and requesting clarification if something is not understood.

6BD46570B1B94F059226964776C70EAE.description: Continue a conversation through multiple exchanges.

B3ADD834A75A4432909191E350B38CA3.description: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., listening to others and taking turns speaking about the topics and texts under discussion).

6D44E41210124027974931E1F8799B7B.description: Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners about kindergarten topics and texts with peers and adults in small and larger groups.

2B0AF91A78424CD882BFEC082C78E075.description: Communication relies on effective verbal and nonverbal skills.

635FBF63164A4DD999620C10EC711EA5.description: Relate new vocabulary to prior knowledge.

F5ACE42AC45C47579EBBDD36B85FE73C.description: Use new vocabulary that is directly taught through reading, speaking, and listening.

BA1361C6C74A48A8B89DE9F96FC9E39A.description: Express words and word meanings as encountered in books and conversation.

3CF2679BADEC4E2E82FCCBE4FF057726.description: Distinguish shades of meaning among verbs describing the same general action (e.g., walk, march, strut, prance) by acting out the meanings.

EFE75195D9514B06ABDC3108972A22AD.description: Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., note places at school that are colorful).

A85AD4743D3D47B397E7E89B96374B7E.description: Demonstrate understanding of frequently occurring verbs and adjectives by relating them to their opposites (antonyms).

D7CC25CB175147D5A81C25AEDCFCED2A.description: Sort common objects into categories (e.g., shapes, foods) to gain a sense of the concepts the categories represent.

79100690AABA4512BA4B582B76CC110D.description: Speak audibly and express thoughts, feelings, and ideas clearly.

108351C9E56841D4966102325A8E8533.description: Add drawings or other visual displays to descriptions as desired to provide additional detail.

85DF2B90E88C44339E9D5753DC2ADD3B.description: Describe familiar people, places, things, and events and, with prompting and support, provide additional detail.

DF1E7E3EB3CE4C7AA3FF7C1A709488AF.description: Oral communication skills are built within a language-rich environment.
